info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 24 at 12:16PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Custer and southwestern Pennington Counties through 100 PM MDT... At 1215 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 3 miles southwest of Crazy Horse Memorial, or 5 miles northwest of Custer, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Crazy Horse Memorial around 1230 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include northwestern Custer State Park, Sylvan Lake and Custer. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
